description: Back-formation from dawning. (If the noun rather than the verb is primary, the noun could directly continue dawing.) Compare daw (“to dawn”).

entries.meaning: (uncountable) The morning twilight period immediately before sunrise.

examples: Synonyms: break of dawn, break of day, daybreak, day-dawn, dayspring, sunrise

entries.meaning: (uncountable) The time when the sun rises.
examples: Synonyms: break of dawn, break of day, crack of dawn, daybreak, day-dawn, dayspring, sunrise, sunup
She rose before dawn to meet the train.

verbs.description: dawn (third-person singular simple present dawns, present participle dawning, simple past and past participle dawned)

entries.meaning: (intransitive) To begin to brighten with daylight.
(intransitive) To start to appear or be realized.
examples: I don’t want to be there when the truth dawns on him.

entries.meaning: (intransitive) To begin to give promise; to begin to appear or to expand.
